column2: Patient's Global Impression of Change (PGIC) Scale

column13: Reference: Hurst H, Bolton J. Assessing the clinical significance of change scores recorded on subjective outcome measures. J Manipulative Physiol Ther 2004;27:26-35.
column20: Since beginning treatment at this clinic, how would you describe the change (if any) in ACTIVITY LIMITATIONS, SYMPTOMS, EMOTIONS and OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE, related to your painful condition? (select ONE option)

column6: No change (or condition has got worse)
Almost the same, hardly any change at all
A little better, but no noticeable change
Somewhat better, but the change has not made any real world difference
Moderately better, and a slight but noticeable change
Better, and a definite improvement that has made a real and worthwhile difference
A great deal better, and a considerable improvement that has made all the difference

column13: Reference: Hurst H, Bolton J. Assessing the clinical significance of change scores recorded on subjective outcome measures. J Manipulative Physiol Ther 2004;27:26-35.
